result.execSummary:
All charges against ANDREW M HOYT in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. ANDREW M HOYT is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. ANDREW M HOYT

10:26 AM Defendant ANDREW M HOYT in court with attorney Brianne Eileen Patzer.  Defendant ANDREW M HOYT in custody.  David C. Rashid appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant continues to stand mute, requesting an evidentiary hearing in relation to competency.  10:31 a.m.  Dr. sworn and testifies.  10:42 a.m.  Cross examination by Atty Patzer.  Argument by parties.  Findings that State has met burden and finds Defendant is competent to proceed.  Defendant waives time limits to schedule preliminary hearing.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 25, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

The Court did confirm with the State that they are in compliance with Marsy's Law.  ANDREW M HOYT appeared by video means with Attorney.  Attorney Patzer raises competency.  The Court finds probable cause to order a competency evaluation.  Time limits tolled.  Bond Continues.  The Court notes there is no victim present that wishes to make a statement.
